TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SettingsProperty extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Used internally as the class that represents metadata about an individual configuration property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty> is used to describe settings properties of a class derived from <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsBase>. The Settings API allows a collection of settings properties to be grouped into a common language runtime class.
When persisting settings, the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsBase> base class asks for a collection of <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty> objects, grouped in a collection of type <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyCollection>. It does this by calling its own Properties member. Inherited classes should return a collection of properties to persist.
Each <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty> object includes metadata about the property, including the following:
- Name.
- Default value.
- Property type.
- Serialization method.
- Provider to use for persistence.
- Other arbitrary attributes that are context and provider specific.
